summary:
A postgraduate in Water Science and Engineering specialized in Hydrology at the IHE – Delft the institute for water education, the Netherlands. Having completed a B. Sc. Engineering (Honors) degree specialized in Civil and Infrastructure Engineering at Asian Institute of Technology, Bangkok, Thailand in second class upper division, my vision is to become an expert in conventional and emerging fields in the civil engineering stream while developing a strong sense of responsibility towards the country and planet earth as a whole. 
Having a positive attitude towards work and great ability towards result oriented output, ability to work independently, excellent inter personal skills to interact individuals at all levels, positive attitude and enthusiastic in team work, excellent written and communication skills, excellent grasping power and technical skills, high level of professionalism, quick learning ability;  seeking to develop the career with a dynamic organization who is specialized in civil engineering, geotechnical engineering, hydrology and hydrogeology while contributing to grow the organization to achieve its goal.

profile_positions.description:
−	Preparing Stormwater Management Strategies (SWMS) in accordance with the latest industry 
standards and Authority guidelines
−	Performing hydrological modelling of pre-developed and post-developed catchment to inform SWMS and/or hydraulic modelling
−	Water Quality modelling to determine the achievement of Best Practice Environmental Management Guidelines (BPEMG) for Greenfield and Brownfield developments.
−	Performing one-dimension hydraulic modelling of natural creek and constructed waterways to determine 
flood levels under different rainfall conditions.
−	Preparing concept and functional design of Water Sensitive Urban Design (WSUD) solutions to be 
integrated within proposed development.
−	Preparing the required documentation with Geographic Information System (GIS) software to 
visualise and analyse the required data to inform SWMS and drainage investigations.
profile_positions.title: Water Resources Engineer

company.name: Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation

profile_positions.company: Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation
profile_positions.description:
Project Name: “Rathgama” Township Development & Drainage Improvement Project, Rathgama, Galle District, Sri Lanka (Project Estimated cost 4.95 USD Million)
On site experience 
	Land Acquisition
	Social Awareness
	Data Collection   
	Geotechnical Investigations
	Engineering survey: 
	Construction Supervision and Project management: Supervising the quality of the work of the contractor according to the provided method statements and guidelines. Moreover, scheduling the project key activities and guiding the construction teams to achieve the key deadlines in cost effective manner. 
Office Experience  
	Data Collection and Distribution: Collecting survey data, geotechnical investigation data organizing them and distributing to the relevant design engineers.
	Initial project approvals: Preparing the reports for pre-project approvals from the stakeholder agencies in Sri Lanka such as Central Environmental Project (IEE), Archaeological department, Coast Conservation Department etc from the collected data through literature and from the field.
	Drainage Design: Working collaboratively with the hydrologists to develop, simulations, calibrating and validating 1D/2D hydrological and hydrodynamical models to output the drainage design for the project.
	Civil/Structural Engineering Designs: Working actively with senior design engineers to conduct the detailed structural designs of the key features of the project. Foundation Designs, Ground Improvement, culvert & road designs etc.
	Cost Estimation & Preparations of contract documents: Working collaboratively with the quantity surveyor/contract engineer of the project in preparation of the contract document of the main project and for the sub projects, i.e lately available for competitive bidding for different contractors.  
	Reporting & Presentations: Reporting/ Presenting the progress/issues of the project to the senior officials, line minister and other governmental officials upon request.
profile_positions.title: Civil Engineer

company.name: Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation

profile_positions.company: Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation
profile_positions.description:
Regional Office: Colombo South Regional Office, Kirimandalawatha, Narahenpita, Sri Lanka. (This office is responsible in maintaining and rehabilitating of 38 km off 67 km long canal system in the Colombo metropolitan area to maintain proper conveyance to make the area less vulnerable for urban floods occurred due to high intensity rainfalls receive in shorter periods to the area).   
Canal Maintenance office experience.
-	Surveying: Regularly conducting engineering surveys along the canals (both L.S and C.S in 20m intervals) to understand canal debris levels and to determine the level of criticalness of maintain a particular section. In addition, conducting engineering surveys to collect design details required for canal bank protection (earth retaining structures) designs.
-	Labour handling: Managing 120+ labours including 2 engineering assistance and 8 foremen in canal maintenance activities.
-	Reporting – Preparation of physical progress and financial progress related to canal maintenance and related project and reporting to the head office.  
Construction & Design Experience
-	Design - Construction of Gabion Wall (Gravity type retain structures) at Heen Ela Near SLLDC Workshop & Playground at Kirimandala Mawatha, Narahenpita (Project Estimated cost 101,633 USD).
-	Construction supervision and Rehabilitation – Quality assurance at the aforementioned construction work and rehabilitating the canal bank protection structures (both gravity and retaining type retaining structures).
Managing a Sea Sand Selling Centre (for construction purposes)
-	Managing a sea sand selling centre attached to the regional office.
-	Maintaining inventory 
-	Approving and reporting daily sales report
-	Facilitating the sand selling centre for an unerupted service
profile_positions.title: Civil Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Project Name: Design & Build of North Lock Pumping Station Project, Nagalagam Street, Colombo 14 (Project Estimated cost 9.57 USD Million)  
Office Experience-
	Construction Administration – Attending to the issues raise by the consultant and contractor of the project according to the clauses of the contract
	Reporting – Preparation of daily inspection reports and 
	Environmental and Safety – Inspecting the contractor is following the environmental and safety guidelines agreed at the awarding the project to them
	Payment approval – Checking the interim payment certificate forwarded by the contractor and the consultant of the project and report to client.
	Resettlement Work – Surveying, recording and reporting about the families affected by the project scope.

profile_positions.title: Trainee

profile_positions.description:
Handled cost-of-materials estimations, report and document tracking, project documentation, on-site project visits, invoice/agreement verification and building permit applications. 
 Gained experience in blueprint reading, as well as preparation of maps and plans. 
 Planning and Execution of works as per design & drawing. 
 Preparation of daily, weekly, monthly, reports on work progress (key performance indicator) & evaluating as per the planned schedules. 
 Maintaining quality standards for all structural works. 
 Supervision of the working labor to ensure strict conformance to methods, quality and safety. 
 Study of the related documents such as drawings, Electrical drawings, plans etc. 
 Checking the quality of RCC works such as foundations, columns, beams, walls and slabs etc.
